snippet: Two major medical groups agree there is no scientific evidence that the exams save lives, but they disagree on whether that lack of medicine matters.
abstract: Editorial notes disparity in opinions by American College of Physicians, which opposes annual pelvic exams for asymptomatic women, and American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists, which supports them; points out they both agree there is no credible scientific evidence that the exams save lives; holds women will need to make their own judgments.
lead_paragraph: Two major medical groups agree there is no scientific evidence that the exams save lives, but they disagree on whether that lack of medicine matters.

headline.main: The Dispute Over Annual Pelvic Exams
headline.print_headline: The Dispute Over Annual Pelvic Exams

keywords.value: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists
keywords.name: organizations
